keyMoments.description: The Flying Fish Riders' attempt to crush the Thousand Sunny is thwarted by the Gaon Cannon, which destroys their hideout
keyMoments.significance: Marks the crew's defeat and the end of their antagonistic relationship with the Straw Hats

keyMoments.description: After Duval's transformation, the crew begins its transition from villainous kidnappers to future allies
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the crew's reformation and eventual renaming to the Rosy Life Riders

description: A gang of outlaws who used flying fish as mounts to kidnap people, particularly targeting mermaids. Led by the masked Duval, they operated from a hidden base near the Sabaody Archipelago. After Duval's face was transformed by Sanji, the crew reformed and eventually became allies of the Straw Hats.

keyMoments.description: The crew uses the Thousand Sunny's secret weapon, the Gaon Cannon, for the first time in combat
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the ship's full combat capabilities and Franky's genius as a shipwright

keyMoments.description: Successfully resolves the conflict with Duval through Sanji's Parage Shot, turning an enemy into an ally
keyMoments.significance: Continues the crew's pattern of making allies out of former enemies
